description: It's certainly not the first time U.S. President Donald Trump has insulted a female reporter, but calling Bloomberg's Catherine Lucey 'piggy' on Air Force One, then berating ABC News' Mary Bruce a few days later has raised questions about just how much journalists are expected to tolerate as they do their jobs.
title: 'Quiet, piggy': As Trump berates female reporters, what's the breaking point?

description: The U.K. government announced that it is banning the resale of concert, sports, and live event tickets above face value. Fans there could be saved from shelling out around $206 million annually for tickets.
title: U.K. government moves to ban inflated resale of tickets for entertainment and sports events

description: The Trump administration announced on Thursday new oil drilling off the California and Florida coasts for the first time in decades, advancing a project that critics say could harm coastal communities and ecosystems, as U.S. President Donald Trump seeks to expand U.S. oil production.
title: Trump administration touts plan for new oil drilling off California, Florida

description: U.S. President Donald Trump defended Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman during his Oval Office visit after an ABC News reporter asked about his connection to the 2018 assassination of Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi. Andrew Chang breaks down what the exchange highlights about two key relationships: Trump and the media, and the U.S. and Saudi Arabia. Images provided by The Canadian Press, Reuters and Getty Images
title: How one reporter’s question struck at the core of U.S.-Saudi relations | About That

description: U.S. President Donald Trump has lashed out at six congressional Democrats who this week released a video to social media advising troops they can decline unlawful orders, branding it seditious behaviour.
title: Democratic vets in Congress warn about following unlawful military orders, which Trump calls seditious

description: Bell Canada says it's cutting about 690 employees, mostly managers, to help reduce debt and drive growth. The cuts follow thousands of company layoffs last year.
title: Bell slashes nearly 700 jobs in latest round of layoffs

description: Liberal MP Chrystia Freeland will move to Oxford, England, to take on a new position next summer administering the Rhodes Trust, the educational charity says.
title: Freeland will move to U.K. for new job as CEO of Rhodes Trust educational charity

description: According to the latest edition of the Canadian Food Sentiment Index, four out of every five people surveyed said food is their top expense pressure.
title: Rising cost of food is changing how Canadians eat, survey shows

description: The "Lost Canadians" legislation, which aims to fix Canada's unconstitutional citizenship by descent rules, passed in the Senate Wednesday and is on track to become law.
title: Bill restoring citizenship for 'Lost Canadians' clears Senate, will become law

description: A U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention website has been changed to contradict the longtime scientific conclusion that vaccines do not cause autism, spurring outrage among a number of public health and autism experts.
title: CDC adopts Robert F. Kennedy's anti-vaccine views on autism website

description: “Thank goodness no one was hurt,” Mayor Olivia Chow told reporters before confirming city staff have been asked to investigate incident.
title: City investigating after videos show Toronto contractor drive snowplow through pro-Palestinian demonstration

description: Former British prime minister Boris Johnson oversaw a "toxic," "chaotic" and dithering response to the COVID-19 pandemic, with a delay in locking the country down resulting in about 23,000 more deaths, a report by a public inquiry concluded on Thursday.
title: Delay in COVID-19 lockdowns in U.K. resulted in some 23,000 more deaths: public inquiry

description: Space is a harsh environment: it's a vacuum with freezing temperatures, super high ultraviolet radiation and, of course, almost no oxygen. But Japanese researchers have found a type of moss that doesn’t really care about much of that.
title: This moss survived 9 months outside the International Space Station in the harshness of space

description: Prime Minister Mark Carney signed an investment-protection agreement with the United Arab Emirates on Thursday, during a visit to Abu Dhabi that has involved limited media access as concerns grow the country is fuelling ethnic violence in Sudan.
title: Carney signs U.A.E. investment pact, launches trade talks during Abu Dhabi visit

description: Israeli airstrikes killed five people and wounded 18 others in Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip on Thursday, local health authorities said, after Hamas and Israel accused each other of violating an increasingly fragile six-week-old truce.
title: Deadly Israeli strikes in Gaza continue into Thursday, with 32 killed in past 24 hours

description: A national coalition of advocacy groups, health-care organizations and a telecommunications company have come together to demand the federal government reintroduce legislation to protect children from online exploitation.
title: Children's advocates want new online harms legislation before the end of the year

description: A 43-year-old convicted murderer incarcerated since a teen has been handed an additional 12 months behind bars for confining two correctional guards, with a Nova Scotia judge remarking on the lengthy periods in segregation she has faced during her time in the prison system.
title: Long-serving inmate with history of prison hostage-takings sentenced in Nova Scotia

description: Ukraine and Europe must be consulted on any efforts to end Russia's invasion of its neighbour, top European diplomats said Thursday, as reports circulated about a U.S.-Russian proposal to end the war at a time when corruption allegations have rattled Ukraine's government.
title: Europe, Ukraine must be involved in U.S.-Russia peace plan circulating, European diplomats say

description: Baraah Mohammad wanted to join her family in Canada after fleeing the war. What ensued was an eight-year struggle through the immigration process.
title: Syrian family reunited in Alberta after nearly a decade of immigration hurdles

description: A former golf course north of Winnipeg purchased with money Peguis First Nation received as reparation for broken treaty promises is now mostly in the hands of a property developer who used to advise the band and its real estate trust.
title: $10M deal gives Winnipeg developer control of land from First Nation he advised

description: Canadian businesses and retailers are hoping shoppers will continue to support local this holiday season, but ten months into the trade war with the U.S., the cost of living is now a major contributing factor in consumer spending.
title: ‘Buy Canadian’ could take a backseat to cost and convenience this Christmas

description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he will meet New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani at the White House on Friday in what would be the first meeting of the Republican leader with the democratic socialist who won this month's mayoral election.
title: Trump to meet NYC mayor-elect Mamdani at White House on Friday
Government seeks to retroactively change law, potentially avoiding paying veterans over federal error
Government 'sneakily' moving to avoid paying veterans over federal error, Conservatives say

description: In the age of screens, amid reports of retail stores struggling and studies suggesting that all kids want for Christmas are Robux, what does the future hold for the toy industry?
title: Are toy stores dying? Why big-box chains are struggling even as toy sales climb

description: Every Remembrance Day since Bailey Binns-Franchetto moved into her wartime home in the St. Mary's neighbourhood of Kitchener, Ont., eight years ago, someone has planted a flag on the front lawn. This year, a security camera caught a glimpse of a man, and Binns-Franchetto hopes to find out who he is.
title: Camera catches mystery man saluting outside home where Canadian flag's been left the last 8 Remembrance Days

description: Canada has formally issued firm bidding instructions to the two companies vying to build the navy’s new submarines, CBC News has learned.
title: Canada’s instructions to submarine contract bidders highlight sustainment, economic benefits

description: Amazon is accused of shutting seven Quebec warehouses to avoid a union contract, laying off thousands. The CSN union federation is asking a labour tribunal to overturn the closures and award damages, though experts say remedies may be limited even if Amazon is found at fault.
title: If Quebec tribunal finds Amazon guilty of union-busting, what comes next?

description: Almost three years ago, hundreds of residents in Joshimath, India, were forced to leave after deep cracks appeared in the walls of some 800 homes because the ground was sinking around them. The town's location, climate change and heavy construction are being blamed.
title: In the shadow of the Himalayas, this town is sinking, a casualty of the past and the present

description: Tough new asylum rules proposed by Britain’s Labour government have sparked debate not just in Britain, but within the governing party as critics accuse the leadership of donning a hard-right mantle to counter a rise in the polls by the populist anti-immigration party, Reform UK.
title: ‘Obviously cruel policies’: U.K.’s proposed asylum rules draw pushback from critics

description: Reda Aliwa, 60, is caring for her 36 grandchildren in Gaza City after five of her own children were killed this September. Statistics suggest there are some 40,000 children in Gaza who’ve lost one or more parents, resulting in what one Palestinian organization has called “the largest orphan crisis in modern history.”
title: She lost 5 children during the war in Gaza — now she’s raising 36 grandkids in a tent

description: When it comes to the Epstein files, there are solid reasons to withold certain information from the public, experts say. However, there are also grey areas that could cause disputes between lawmakers and the U.S. Department of Justice, and which could frustrate those seeking as much information as possible about the case.
title: Why the U.S. Justice Department and Congress may battle over redaction of Epstein files
